Docs.remarks: A is the basic building block of a (which is essentially a coherent collection of objects). A represents a certain feature of the hand. This can be either a predicate describing the state of one or more hand parts (e.g.: "the palm of the right hand is facing forward", "the index, middle, ring and pinky fingers are folded") - see , or a predicate describing the relative state of sets of fingers (e.g.: "the index and middle fingers are above the thumb finger", "the thumb finger is touching the middle and ring fingers") - see .
